intro: Tibouchina venosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, velvety purple foliage and showy clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Tibouchina venosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Its rapid growth and ability to spread make it both a popular garden plant and a potential invasive species in certain regions.
